result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin C. Cadeau

11:30 AM Defendant Justin C. Cadeau in court.  Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Justin C. Cadeau.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Court speaks to defendant.  Defendant makes a statement. Court quashes warrant. Bond re-instated.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

9:35 AM Defendant Justin C. Cadeau not in court.  Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Justin C. Cadeau.  ADA Dennis Brown in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense does not know the whereabouts of his client. State asks for a warrant. Court authorizes bench warrant $250.00.

Defendant appears in court with Attorney Richards by zoom. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Richards received complaint and waives reading, enters not guilty pleas. Court accepts waivers and enters pleas. Court sets pre trial for June 7th at 11:15 am. bond continued.

Defendant Justin C. Cadeau appeared in court without counsel. Attorney Karl Peter Hayes appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court quashes warrant and reinstates signature bond. Court adjourns initial appearance to April 4th at 11:00 am. bond continued.
